title: 050 Return statements in try catch block
Although it’s bad practice, it’s possible to add multiple return statements in a exception handling block:

inline_content.Text: Although it’s bad practice, it’s possible to add multiple return statements in a exception handling block:

title: This method will always return 7 since the finally block associated with the try/catch block is executed before anything is returned. Now, as finally has
return 7;
c
, this value supersedes the try/catch return values.

inline_content.Text: This method will always return 7 since the finally block associated with the try/catch block is executed before anything is returned. Now, as finally has
, this value supersedes the try/catch return values.

title: If the catch block returns a primitive value and that primitive value is subsequently changed in the finally block, the value returned in the catch block will be returned and the changes from the finally block will be ignored.

inline_content.Text: If the catch block returns a primitive value and that primitive value is subsequently changed in the finally block, the value returned in the catch block will be returned and the changes from the finally block will be ignored.

title: The example below will print “0”, not “1”.

inline_content.Text: The example below will print “0”, not “1”.
